item.text: Now Korah son of Izhar, the son of Kohath, the son of Levi, and Dathan and Abiram, the sons of Eliab, and On son of Peleth, who were Reubenites, took men

and <st data-num="06965" class="">rebelled</st> <st data-num="06440" class="">against</st> <st data-num="04872" class="">Moses</st>, along with <st data-num="0582" class="">some</st> of the <st data-num="01121 03478">Israelites</st>, <st data-num="02572 03967">250</st> <st data-num="05387" class="">leaders</st><n id="1" /> of the <st data-num="05712" class="">community</st>, <st data-num="07148" class="">chosen</st> from the <st data-num="04150" class="">assembly</st>,<n id="2" /> <st data-num="08034" class="">famous</st> <st data-num="0582" class="">men</st>.<n id="3" />

And they assembled against Moses and Aaron, saying to them, “You take too much upon yourselves, seeing that the whole community is holy, every one of them, and the Lord is among them. Why then do you exalt yourselves above the community of the Lord?”
When Moses heard it he fell down with his face to the ground.

Then he said to Korah and to all his company, “In the morning the Lord will make known who are his, and who is holy. He will cause that person to approach him; the person he has chosen he will cause to approach him.

<st data-num="06213" class="">Do</st> <st data-num="02063" class="">this</st>, <st data-num="07141" class="">Korah</st>, you and <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> your <st data-num="05712" class="">company</st>:<n id="1" /> <st data-num="03947" class="">Take</st> <st data-num="04289" class="">censers</st>,
put fire in them, and set incense on them before the Lord tomorrow, and the man whom the Lord chooses will be holy. You take too much upon yourselves, you sons of Levi!”

<st data-num="04872" class="">Moses</st> <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> <st data-num="07141" class="">Korah</st>, “<st data-num="08085" class="">Listen</st> <st data-num="04994" class="">now</st>, you <st data-num="01121" class="">sons</st> of <st data-num="03878" class="">Levi</st>!

Does it seem too small a thing to you that the God of Israel has separated you from the community of Israel to bring you near to himself, to perform the service of the tabernacle of the Lord, and to stand before the community to minister to them?

He has <st data-num="07126" class="">brought</st> you <st data-num="07126" class="">near</st> and <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> your <st data-num="0251" class="">brothers</st>, the <st data-num="01121" class="">sons</st> of <st data-num="03878" class="">Levi</st>, <st data-num="0854" class="">with</st> you. Do you now <st data-num="01245" class="">seek</st><n id="1" /> the <st data-num="03550" class="">priesthood</st> <st data-num="01571" class="">also</st>?
Therefore you and all your company have assembled together against the Lord! And Aaron—what is he that you murmur against him?”

Then <st data-num="04872" class="">Moses</st> <st data-num="07971 07121">summoned</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="01885" class="">Dathan</st> and <st data-num="048" class="">Abiram</st>, the <st data-num="01121" class="">sons</st> of <st data-num="0446" class="">Eliab</st>, but they <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st>, “We will <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> <st data-num="05927" class="">come up</st>.<n id="2" />

Is it a <st data-num="04592" class="">small thing</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="03588" class="">that</st> you have <st data-num="05927" class="">brought</st> us <st data-num="05927" class="">up</st> out of the <st data-num="0776" class="">land</st> that <st data-num="02100" class="">flows</st> with <st data-num="02461" class="">milk</st> and <st data-num="01706" class="">honey</st>,<n id="2" /> to <st data-num="04191" class="">kill</st> us in the <st data-num="04057" class="">wilderness</st>? <st data-num="03588" class="">Now</st> do you want to <st data-num="08323" class="">make</st> yourself <st data-num="08323" class="">a prince</st><n id="3" /> <st data-num="05921" class="">over</st> us?
Moreover, you have not brought us into a land that flows with milk and honey, nor given us an inheritance of fields and vineyards. Do you think you can blind these men? We will not come up.”
Moses was very angry, and he said to the Lord, “Have no respect for their offering! I have not taken so much as one donkey from them, nor have I harmed any one of them!”
Then Moses said to Korah, “You and all your company present yourselves before the Lord—you and they, and Aaron—tomorrow.
And each of you take his censer, put incense in it, and then each of you present his censer before the Lord: 250 censers, along with you, and Aaron—each of you with his censer.”

So <st data-num="0376" class="">everyone</st> <st data-num="03947" class="">took</st> his <st data-num="04289" class="">censer</st>, <st data-num="05414" class="">put</st> <st data-num="0784" class="">fire</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">in</st> it, and <st data-num="07760" class="">set</st> <st data-num="07004" class="">incense</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">on</st> it, and <st data-num="05975" class="">stood</st> at the <st data-num="06607" class="">entrance</st> of the <st data-num="0168" class="">tent</st> of <st data-num="04150" class="">meeting</st>, with <st data-num="04872" class="">Moses</st> and <st data-num="0175" class="">Aaron</st>.
When Korah assembled the whole community against them at the entrance of the tent of meeting, then the glory of the Lord appeared to the whole community.
The Lord spoke to Moses and Aaron:

“<st data-num="0914" class="">Separate</st> yourselves<n id="1" /> from <st data-num="08432" class="">among</st> <st data-num="02063" class="">this</st> <st data-num="05712" class="">community</st>,<n id="2" /> that I may <st data-num="03615" class="">consume</st> them in an <st data-num="07281" class="">instant</st>.”
Then they threw themselves down with their faces to the ground and said, “O God, the God of the spirits of all people, will you be angry with the whole community when only one man sins?”
So the Lord spoke to Moses:

“<st data-num="01696" class="">Tell</st> the <st data-num="05712" class="">community</st>: ‘<st data-num="05927" class="">Get away</st><n id="1" /> from <st data-num="05439" class="">around</st> the <st data-num="04908" class="">homes</st> of <st data-num="07141" class="">Korah</st>, <st data-num="01885" class="">Dathan</st>, and <st data-num="048" class="">Abiram</st>.’”

Then <st data-num="04872" class="">Moses</st> <st data-num="06965" class="">got up</st><n id="1" /> and <st data-num="01980" class="">went</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> <st data-num="01885" class="">Dathan</st> and <st data-num="048" class="">Abiram</st>; and the <st data-num="02205" class="">elders</st> of <st data-num="03478" class="">Israel</st> <st data-num="01980" class="">went</st> <st data-num="0310" class="">after</st> him.

And he <st data-num="01696" class="">said</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> the <st data-num="05712" class="">community</st>, “<st data-num="05493" class="">Move away</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">from</st> the <st data-num="0168" class="">tents</st> of <st data-num="0428" class="">these</st> <st data-num="07563" class="">wicked</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="0376" class="">men</st>, and do <st data-num="0408" class="">not</st> <st data-num="05060" class="">touch</st> <st data-num="03605" class="">anything</st> they <st data-num="0834" class="">have</st>, <st data-num="06435" class="">lest</st> you be <st data-num="05595" class="">destroyed</st> because<n id="2" /> of <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> their <st data-num="02403" class="">sins</st>.”<n id="3" />

So they <st data-num="05927" class="">got away</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">from</st> the <st data-num="04908" class="">homes</st> of <st data-num="07141" class="">Korah</st>, <st data-num="01885" class="">Dathan</st>, and <st data-num="048" class="">Abiram</st> <st data-num="05439" class="">on every side</st>, and <st data-num="01885" class="">Dathan</st> and <st data-num="048" class="">Abiram</st> <st data-num="03318" class="">came out</st> and <st data-num="05324" class="">stationed</st> themselves<n id="1" /> in the <st data-num="06607" class="">entrances</st> of their <st data-num="0168" class="">tents</st> with their <st data-num="0802" class="">wives</st>, their <st data-num="01121" class="">children</st>, and their <st data-num="02945" class="">toddlers</st>.
Then Moses said, “This is how you will know that the Lord has sent me to do all these works, for I have not done them of my own will.
If these men die a natural death, or if they share the fate of all men, then the Lord has not sent me.

But if the Lord does something entirely new, and the earth opens its mouth and swallows them up along with all that they have, and they go down alive to the grave, then you will know that these men have despised the Lord!”
When he had finished speaking all these words, the ground that was under them split open,

and the <st data-num="0776" class="">earth</st> <st data-num="06605" class="">opened</st> its <st data-num="06310" class="">mouth</st> and <st data-num="01104" class="">swallowed</st> them, along with their <st data-num="01004" class="">households</st>, and <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> <st data-num="07141" class="">Korah’s</st> <st data-num="0120" class="">men</st>, and <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> their <st data-num="07399" class="">goods</st>.

<st data-num="01992" class="">They</st> and <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">that</st> they had <st data-num="03381" class="">went down</st> <st data-num="02416" class="">alive</st> into the <st data-num="07585" class="">pit</st>, and the <st data-num="0776" class="">earth</st> <st data-num="03680" class="">closed</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">over</st> them. So they <st data-num="06" class="">perished</st> from <st data-num="08432" class="">among</st> the <st data-num="06951" class="">community</st>.

<st data-num="03605" class="">All</st> the <st data-num="03478" class="">Israelites</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="0834" class="">who</st> were <st data-num="05439" class="">around</st> them <st data-num="05127" class="">fled</st> at their <st data-num="06963" class="">cry</st>,<n id="2" /> <st data-num="03588" class="">for</st> they <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st>, “<st data-num="06435" class="">What if</st><n id="3" /> the <st data-num="0776" class="">earth</st> <st data-num="01104" class="">swallows</st> us too?”
Then a fire went out from the Lord and devoured the 250 men who offered incense.
(17:1) The Lord spoke to Moses:

“<st data-num="0559" class="">Tell</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="0499" class="">Eleazar</st> <st data-num="01121" class="">son</st> of <st data-num="0175" class="">Aaron</st> the <st data-num="03548" class="">priest</st> to <st data-num="07311" class="">pick up</st><n id="2" /> the <st data-num="04289" class="">censers</st> <st data-num="0996" class="">out of</st> the <st data-num="08316" class="">flame</st>, <st data-num="03588" class="">for</st> they <st data-num="06942" class="">are holy</st>, and then <st data-num="02219" class="">scatter</st> the coals of <st data-num="0784" class="">fire</st><n id="3" /> <st data-num="01973" class="">at a distance</st>.

As for the censers of these men who sinned at the cost of their lives, they must be made into hammered sheets for covering the altar, because they presented them before the Lord and sanctified them. They will become a sign to the Israelites.”

So <st data-num="0499" class="">Eleazar</st> the <st data-num="03548" class="">priest</st> <st data-num="03947" class="">took</st> the <st data-num="05178" class="">bronze</st> <st data-num="04289" class="">censers</st> <st data-num="07126" class="">presented</st> by those who had been <st data-num="08313" class="">burned up</st>, and they were <st data-num="07554" class="">hammered out</st> as a <st data-num="06826" class="">covering</st> for the <st data-num="04196" class="">altar</st>.

It was a memorial for the Israelites, that no outsider who is not a descendant of Aaron should approach to burn incense before the Lord, that he might not become like Korah and his company—just as the Lord had spoken by the authority of Moses.
But on the next day the whole community of Israelites murmured against Moses and Aaron, saying, “You have killed the Lord’s people!”
When the community assembled against Moses and Aaron, they turned toward the tent of meeting—and the cloud covered it, and the glory of the Lord appeared.
Then Moses and Aaron stood before the tent of meeting.
The Lord spoke to Moses:

“<st data-num="07426" class="">Get away</st> <st data-num="08432" class="">from</st> <st data-num="02063" class="">this</st> <st data-num="05712" class="">community</st>, so that I can <st data-num="03615" class="">consume</st> them in an <st data-num="07281" class="">instant</st>!” But they <st data-num="05307" class="">threw</st> themselves <st data-num="05307" class="">down</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">with</st> their <st data-num="06440" class="">faces</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">to the ground</st>.<n id="1" />

Then Moses said to Aaron, “Take the censer, put burning coals from the altar in it, place incense on it, and go quickly into the assembly and make atonement for them, for wrath has gone out from the Lord—the plague has begun!”

So <st data-num="0175" class="">Aaron</st> <st data-num="03947" class="">did</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="0834" class="">as</st> <st data-num="04872" class="">Moses</st> <st data-num="01696" class="">commanded</st><n id="2" /> and <st data-num="07323" class="">ran</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">into</st> the <st data-num="08432" class="">middle</st> of the <st data-num="06951" class="">assembly</st>, <st data-num="02009" class="">where</st> the <st data-num="05063" class="">plague</st> <st data-num="02490" class="">was</st> just <st data-num="02490" class="">beginning</st> among the <st data-num="05971" class="">people</st>. So he <st data-num="05414" class="">placed</st> <st data-num="07004" class="">incense</st> on the coals and <st data-num="03722" class="">made atonement</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">for</st> the <st data-num="05971" class="">people</st>.

He <st data-num="05975" class="">stood</st> <st data-num="0996" class="">between</st> the <st data-num="04191" class="">dead</st> and the <st data-num="02416" class="">living</st>, and the <st data-num="04046" class="">plague</st> was <st data-num="06113" class="">stopped</st>.

<st data-num="01961" class="">Now</st> <st data-num="0702 06240 0505 07651 03967">14,700</st> people <st data-num="04191" class="">died</st> in the <st data-num="04046" class="">plague</st>, <st data-num="0905" class="">in addition to</st> those who <st data-num="04191" class="">died</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">in</st> the <st data-num="01697" class="">event</st> with <st data-num="07141" class="">Korah</st>.
Then Aaron returned to Moses at the entrance of the tent of meeting, and the plague was stopped.
